TextBody:
Hello,

Do you mean that you do not see the option on the menu after logging in with your user?



Can you please confirm under "System Configuration > System Administrators" what Administrator role your user has?


Super Administrator can see and edit the alerts.

If you are setting alerts please also check the SMTP setting in "System Configuration > System Settings" before setting up alerts.


Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000NgOOt:ref

Hi Andrei,

We found the reason why we cannot access the Endpoint Protector server.
Our Endpoint Protector server is receiving a lot of logs from clients. Hence CPU usage of our server is very high and cannot maintain the session from remote.
That’s why we cannot try the solution that you told me.

Could you please me how can I reduce the number of logs that Endpoint Protector server receives?

Best Regards,
Juinchi
